question:
Which Articles of the Constitution of India provide for a parliamentary form of government at the Centre?

SSC MTS 07/10/2024 (3rd Shift)
solution:
• Articles 74 and 75 provide for a parliamentary form of government at the Centre.
  • Article 74: States that there shall be a Council of Ministers with the Prime Minister at the head to aid and advise the President.
  • Article 75: Deals with the appointment, tenure, and responsibilities of the Prime Minister and other ministers.
  • These articles ensure collective responsibility of the Council of Ministers to the Lok Sabha, a key feature of the parliamentary system.

Additional Information:

  • Article 76: Pertains to the Attorney General of India.
  • Article 77: Deals with the business conduct of the Government of India.
  • Article 79: Defines the composition of Parliament (President + Lok Sabha + Rajya Sabha).
  • Article 80: Relates to the composition of the Rajya Sabha.

question:
Which of the following articles of the Constitution of India mentions that every Minister and the Attorney-General of India shall have the right to speak in and participate in the proceedings of either House of Parliament?

SSC MTS 08/10/2024 (1st Shift)
solution:
• Article 88 of the Constitution of India grants the right to every Minister and the Attorney-General of India to speak in and take part in the proceedings of either House of Parliament, their joint sittings, and any committee of Parliament of which they may be named a member.
  • However, they do not have the right to vote if they are not a member of the House concerned.

Additional Information:

  • Article 86: Deals with the Right of the President to address and send messages to either House of Parliament.
  • Article 87: Relates to the special address by the President at the commencement of the first session after each general election and the first session of each year.
  • Article 89: Concerns the Chairman and Deputy Chairman of the Rajya Sabha.
  • Article 88: Ensures participation of Ministers and Attorney-General in parliamentary proceedings without being elected members.

question:
Which Article of the Constitution explains that the executive power of every state shall be so exercised as not to impede or prejudice the exercise of the executive power of the Union, and the executive power of the union shall extend to the giving of such directions to a state as may appear to the Government of India to be necessary for that purpose?

SSC CGL 09/09/2024 (2nd Shift)
solution:
• Article 257 of the Constitution of India explains the relationship between the Union and the States regarding executive power.
  • It states that the executive power of every state must be exercised in a manner that does not impede or prejudice the exercise of the executive power of the Union.
  • Furthermore, the executive power of the Union extends to issuing necessary directions to a state to ensure this coordination.

Additional Information:

  • Article 261: Deals with the public acts, records, and judicial proceedings and their full faith and credit across India.
  • Article 247: Empowers Parliament to establish additional courts for Union territories.
  • Article 123: Grants the President the power to promulgate ordinances during the recess of Parliament.
  • Article 257: Helps maintain federal coordination by allowing the Union to guide states in specific matters where Union interest is involved.

question:
Article 77 of the Indian Constitution deals with the __________.

SSC CGL 09/09/2024 (3rd Shift)
option_1: term of office of the Vice-President
option_2: Vice- President of India
option_3: oath of office by the Vice-President
option_4: conduct of business of the Government of India
solution:
• Article 77 of the Indian Constitution deals with the conduct of business of the Government of India.
  • It lays down that all executive actions of the Government of India shall be expressed in the name of the President.
  • It also empowers the President to make rules for the allocation and transaction of government business.

Additional Information:

  • Article 63 to 70: Cover various aspects of the Vice-President of India, including election, term, and removal.
  • Article 66: Relates to the election of the Vice-President.
  • Article 67: Specifies the term of office.
  • Article 69: Deals with the oath or affirmation by the Vice-President.
  • Article 77: Ensures proper administrative procedure within the Union Government.

question:
Which of the following Articles of the Indian Constitution mentions, about the organisation of 'Village Panchayats'?

SSC CGL 10/09/2024 (2nd Shift)
solution:
• Article 40 of the Indian Constitution deals with the organisation of Village Panchayats.
  • It is a part of the Directive Principles of State Policy (Part IV).
  • It directs the State to take steps to organise Gram Panchayats and enable them to function as units of self-government.
  • Though not enforceable by court, it is fundamental to the governance of the country.

Additional Information:

  • Article 31: (Repealed) earlier dealt with the Right to Property (now a legal right under Article 300A).
  • Article 36: Provides the definition of ‘State’ for the purpose of Directive Principles.
  • Article 38: Directs the State to promote welfare of the people by securing social, economic, and political justice.
  • Article 40: Lays the foundation for Panchayati Raj system in India.

question:
Which Article of the Constitution of India deals with the conduct of business of the Government of a state?

SSC CGL 11/09/2024 (3rd Shift)
solution:
• Article 166 of the Indian Constitution deals with the conduct of business of the Government of a State.
  • It states that all executive actions of a State shall be expressed to be taken in the name of the Governor.
  • The Governor is also empowered to make rules for the more convenient transaction of business and the allocation among ministers of the said business.

Additional Information:

  • Article 164: Deals with the appointment of Chief Minister and other Ministers and their responsibilities.
  • Article 167: Describes the duties of the Chief Minister regarding furnishing information to the Governor.
  • Article 177: Grants Ministers and Advocate General the right to attend and speak in the State Legislature.
  • Article 166: Ensures a structured administrative process in the State Executive similar to Article 77 at the Union level.

question:
Which Article of the Indian Constitution provides that the State must secure a social order to promote the welfare of people?

SSC CGL 12/09/2024 (3rd Shift)
solution:
• Article 38 of the Indian Constitution provides that the State shall strive to promote the welfare of the people by securing a social order in which justice — social, economic, and political — shall inform all institutions of national life.
  • This article is part of the Directive Principles of State Policy (Part IV) and reflects the socio-economic vision of the Constitution.

Additional Information:

  • Article 36: Provides the definition of ‘State’ for the purposes of Directive Principles.
  • Article 37: Declares that Directive Principles are not enforceable by any court, but they are fundamental in governance.
  • Article 39: Lays down several important principles like equal pay for equal work, right to livelihood, etc.
  • Article 38: Envisions a just and equitable social order, guiding State policy-making.

question:
Which article of the Constitution of India lays down that it shall be the duty of the Advocate-General to give advice to the Government of the State upon legal matters?

SSC CGL 17/09/2024 (2nd Shift)
solution:
• Article 165 of the Indian Constitution provides for the office of the Advocate-General for each State.
  • It states that the Advocate-General shall be appointed by the Governor, and it shall be his duty to advise the State Government upon such legal matters as may be referred to him.
  • The Advocate-General is the highest law officer of the State, similar to the Attorney General at the Centre.

Additional Information:

  • Article 166: Relates to the conduct of business of the Government of a State.
  • Article 167: Specifies the duties of the Chief Minister with respect to the Governor.
  • Article 168: Deals with the composition of State Legislatures (Legislative Assembly and Legislative Council).
  • Article 165: Establishes the legal advisory role of the Advocate-General at the State level.

question:
Articles 245 to 255 in Part XI of the Indian Constitution deal with the _______.

SSC CGL 19/09/2024 (2nd Shift)
option_2: financial relations between the Centre and the states
option_3: legislative relations between the Centre and the states
solution:
• Articles 245 to 255 in Part XI of the Indian Constitution deal with the legislative relations between the Centre and the States.
  • These articles define the distribution of legislative powers, i.e., who can make laws on what subjects.
  • They cover the Union List, State List, and Concurrent List and also discuss parliamentary powers, extra-territorial jurisdiction, and residuary powers.

Additional Information:

  • Article 245: Extent of laws made by Parliament and by the Legislatures of States.
  • Article 246: Distribution of legislative powers via three lists — Union, State, and Concurrent.
  • Article 248: Residuary powers vested in Parliament.
  • Articles 256 to 263 (Part XI, Chapter II): Deal with administrative relations.
  • Emergency provisions are covered under Part XVIII (Articles 352 to 360).
  • Tribunals are covered under Articles 323A and 323B in Part XIV-A.

question:
Which Article of the Indian Constitution mentions that ‘The State shall endeavour to promote cottage industries on an individual or co-operative basis in rural areas’?

SSC CGL 19/09/2024 (3rd Shift)
solution:
• Article 43 of the Indian Constitution directs that The State shall endeavour to promote cottage industries on an individual or cooperative basis in rural areas.
  • This article is part of the Directive Principles of State Policy (Part IV), which guide the government in policymaking for social and economic welfare.
  • It reflects the vision of rural self-reliance and inclusive growth.

Additional Information:

  • Article 42: Deals with provision for just and humane conditions of work and maternity relief.
  • Article 44: Talks about the Uniform Civil Code for the citizens.
  • Article 49: Directs the State to protect monuments and places of national importance.
  • Article 43: Encourages village-level economic development through support for cottage industries.

question:
Which part of the Constitution deals with the Panchayats?

SSC CGL 23/09/2024 (1st Shift)
solution:
• Part IX of the Indian Constitution deals with the Panchayats.
  • It was added by the 73rd Constitutional Amendment Act, 1992, which came into effect on 24th April 1993.
  • It contains Articles 243 to 243-O, providing a constitutional status to Panchayati Raj institutions.
  • This part lays down the structure, composition, powers, elections, and functioning of rural local self-governments.

Additional Information:

  • Part IV: Deals with the Directive Principles of State Policy (Articles 36 to 51).
  • Part VII: Initially dealt with States in Part B, but was repealed by the 7th Amendment Act, 1956.
  • Part X: Relates to Scheduled and Tribal Areas (Article 244).
  • Part IX: Marks a landmark reform in decentralised governance through Panchayati Raj.

question:
Articles 52 to 78 in Part V of the Indian Constitution deal with __________.

SSC CGL 23/09/2024 (1st Shift)
option_1: Finance Commission of India
option_3: Amendment of the Constitution
solution:
• Articles 52 to 78 in Part V of the Indian Constitution deal with the Union Executive.
  • The Union Executive consists of the President, Vice-President, Prime Minister, Council of Ministers, and the Attorney General of India.
  • These articles lay down their powers, functions, election, and responsibilities.

Additional Information:

  • Article 52: There shall be a President of India.
  • Article 63: Provides for the Vice-President of India.
  • Article 74 & 75: Deal with the Council of Ministers and Prime Minister.
  • Article 76: Defines the Attorney General of India.
  • Article 78: Duties of the Prime Minister to furnish information to the President.
  • Finance Commission is covered under Article 280 in Part XII.
  • Amendment of Constitution is under Article 368, Part XX.
  • National Emergency is dealt with in Article 352, Part XVIII.

question:
Which of the following articles of the Indian constitution deals with the parliament and its proceedings?

SSC CGL 24/09/2024 (3rd Shift)
solution:
• Articles 79 to 122 of the Indian Constitution deal with the Parliament of India and its proceedings.
  • These articles are part of Part V of the Constitution and cover the structure, composition, powers, privileges, and functioning of both Lok Sabha and Rajya Sabha.
  • It includes provisions regarding Parliamentary sessions, voting, presiding officers, and legislative procedures.

Additional Information:

  • Article 79: Establishes the Parliament (President + Rajya Sabha + Lok Sabha).
  • Article 80–104: Deal with composition and functioning of the Houses.
  • Article 105: Talks about powers and privileges of members.
  • Article 122: Protects parliamentary proceedings from judicial review.
  • Article 51A: Lists the Fundamental Duties (Part IVA).
  • Article 36 to 51: Include Directive Principles of State Policy (Part IV).
  • Article 12 to 35: Relate to Fundamental Rights (Part III).

question:
Which Article of the Indian Constitution provides for protecting and improving the environment safeguarding forests and wildlife?

SSC CGL 25/09/2024 (1st Shift)
solution:
• Article 48-A of the Indian Constitution directs the State to protect and improve the environment and to safeguard forests and wildlife.
  • This article was added by the 42nd Constitutional Amendment Act, 1976, and is a part of the Directive Principles of State Policy (Part IV).
  • It reflects India's commitment to sustainable development and ecological balance.

Additional Information:

  • Article 47: Deals with the duty of the State to improve public health and nutrition.
  • Articles 47-A, 47-B, and 49-C do not exist in the Constitution.
  • Article 51A(g) (Fundamental Duties) also mentions that it is the duty of every citizen to protect the environment.
  • Article 48-A complements this by placing a similar responsibility on the State.

question:
Which of the following Articles of the Indian Constitution mentions that ‘The State shall, in particular, direct its Policy towards securing that the ownership and control of the material resources of the community are so distributed as best to subserve the common good’?

SSC CGL 25/09/2024 (3rd Shift)
solution:
• Article 39(b) of the Indian Constitution states that “The State shall, in particular, direct its policy towards securing that the ownership and control of the material resources of the community are so distributed as best to subserve the common good.”
  • This provision is a part of the Directive Principles of State Policy (Part IV) and aims to ensure equitable distribution of resources for the benefit of all sections of society.
  • It reflects the principle of economic justice and aims at reducing inequality.

Additional Information:

  • Article 39(a): Ensures right to an adequate means of livelihood for all citizens.
  • Article 39(c): Aims to prevent concentration of wealth and means of production to the common detriment.
  • Article 39(d): Seeks to provide equal pay for equal work for both men and women.
  • Article 39 (as a whole): Focuses on the economic directives for promoting welfare and justice in society.

question:
Which of the following Articles and Parts of the Indian Constitution deal with the State Legislature?

SSC CGL 26/09/2024 (1st Shift)
option_1: Articles 214 to 231 in Part VI
option_2: Articles 168 to 212 in Part VI
option_3: Articles 243 to 243-O in Part IX
option_4: Articles 79 to 122 in Part V
solution:
• Articles 168 to 212 in Part VI of the Indian Constitution deal with the State Legislature.
  • These provisions cover the structure, composition, powers, privileges, procedures, and functioning of the Legislative Assemblies and Legislative Councils (where applicable) in the states.
  • It includes matters like qualification of members, sessions, voting, disqualifications, and legislative procedures at the state level.

Additional Information:

  • Article 168: Establishes the Legislature for every State, which may consist of one or two Houses.
  • Article 169: Allows for the abolition or creation of Legislative Councils in states.
  • Article 170–171: Deal with composition of the Legislative Assembly and Council.
  • Article 212: Bars courts from inquiring into the validity of proceedings in the Legislature.
  • Articles 214 to 231 in Part VI: Deal with the High Courts in the States.
  • Articles 243 to 243-O in Part IX: Concern the Panchayati Raj system.
  • Articles 79 to 122 in Part V: Relate to the Union Parliament.

question:
Which Article of the Indian Constitution mentions about the 'Promotion of educational and economic interests of Scheduled Castes, Scheduled Tribes and other weaker sections'?

SSC CGL 26/09/2024 (3rd Shift)
solution:
• Article 46 of the Indian Constitution directs the State to promote the educational and economic interests of the Scheduled Castes (SCs), Scheduled Tribes (STs), and other weaker sections of society.
  • It is part of the Directive Principles of State Policy (Part IV), emphasizing the need to protect these groups from social injustice and all forms of exploitation.

Additional Information:

  • Article 45: Deals with early childhood care and education for children below the age of six years.
  • Article 47: Pertains to the duty of the State to raise the level of nutrition and improve public health.
  • Article 48: Relates to the organization of agriculture and animal husbandry, and prohibits slaughter of cows and calves.
  • Article 46: Forms the foundation of affirmative action and social justice for disadvantaged groups.

question:
Which Article of the Constitution mentions that "the Parliament consists of the President and two Houses known as the Council of States (Rajya Sabha) and the House of the People (Lok Sabha)"?

SSC CHSL 03/07/2024 (2nd shift)
solution:
• Article 79 of the Indian Constitution states that the Parliament consists of the President and two Houses known as the Council of States (Rajya Sabha) and the House of the People (Lok Sabha).
  • This article establishes the bicameral legislature at the Union level.
  • It forms the basis for the structure and composition of the Indian Parliament.

Additional Information:

  • Article 80: Deals with the composition of the Rajya Sabha.
  • Article 81: Deals with the composition of the Lok Sabha.
  • Article 82: Relates to the readjustment of constituencies after each census.
  • Article 73 and Article 70: Are unrelated to the composition of Parliament.

question:
In a situation wherein A (female) and B (male) are working in the same office, same designation, same nature of work but unequal payment, which of the following Articles of the Constitution be applicable?

SSC CHSL 03/07/2024 (3rd shift)
solution:
• Article 39(d) of the Indian Constitution is applicable in this situation.
  • It directs the State to ensure equal pay for equal work for both men and women.
  • This article is part of the Directive Principles of State Policy aimed at promoting gender equality and fair treatment in employment.

Additional Information:

  • Article 48A: Deals with the protection and improvement of the environment.
  • Article 21: Guarantees the right to life and personal liberty.
  • Article 18: Abolishes titles except military and academic.
  • Article 39(d): Specifically targets equal remuneration for men and women performing the same work.

question:
Which Articles of the Constitution deal with citizenship?

SSC CHSL 03/07/2024 (4th shift)
solution:
• Articles 5 to 11 of the Indian Constitution deal with citizenship.
  • These articles define the criteria for acquiring citizenship at the commencement of the Constitution, citizenship by birth, descent, registration, and naturalization.
  • They also cover termination of citizenship and rights of citizenship of persons migrating to India from Pakistan.

Additional Information:

  • Article 5: Citizenship at the commencement of the Constitution.
  • Articles 6 to 8: Deal with citizenship in relation to persons migrating to India from Pakistan.
  • Article 9: Provides that no person shall be a citizen if they voluntarily acquire citizenship of a foreign state.
  • Article 10: Continuance of citizenship of persons who have migrated to India.
  • Article 11: Empower Parliament to regulate the right of citizenship by law.

question:
Under the discretionary power of which Article of the Indian Constitution did the SC of India recognise sex work as a profession?

SSC CHSL 04/07/2024 (4th shift)
solution:
• The Supreme Court of India recognized sex work as a profession under the discretionary power granted by Article 142 of the Indian Constitution.
  • Article 142 empowers the Supreme Court to pass any decree or order necessary for doing complete justice in any case before it.
  • This power allows the Court to deliver wide-ranging remedies beyond strict legal provisions.

Additional Information:

  • Article 141: Declares that the law declared by the Supreme Court shall be binding on all courts in India.
  • Article 143: Deals with the advisory jurisdiction of the Supreme Court.
  • Article 140: Relates to the establishment of High Courts in certain states.
  • The use of Article 142 demonstrates the Supreme Court's commitment to justice beyond rigid legal frameworks.

question:
Which of the following Articles in the Constitution of India provides protection to the President and Governors and Rajpramukhs?

SSC CHSL 05/07/2024 (3rd shift)
solution:
• Article 361 of the Indian Constitution provides protection to the President, Governors, and Rajpramukhs from legal proceedings during their term of office.
  • It grants immunity from prosecution and court cases for actions done in their official capacity.

Additional Information:

  • Article 352: Deals with National Emergency provisions.
  • Article 356: Deals with President's Rule in states.
  • Article 370: Provided special autonomous status to Jammu and Kashmir (now abrogated).
  • Article 361: Ensures that the highest constitutional functionaries can perform their duties without legal harassment.

question:
Which Article provides that all minorities have the right to establish and administer educational institutions of their choice?

SSC CHSL 08/07/2024 (1st shift)
solution:
• Article 30 of the Indian Constitution provides that all minorities, whether based on religion or language, have the right to establish and administer educational institutions of their choice.
  • This article safeguards the educational rights of minorities and allows them to preserve their culture and language through education.
  • It is a fundamental right under Part III of the Constitution.

Additional Information:

  • Article 26: Grants every religious denomination the right to manage its own religious affairs.
  • Article 24: Prohibits child labor under the age of 14 in factories and hazardous employment.
  • Article 32: Provides the right to constitutional remedies for the enforcement of fundamental rights.
  • Article 30: Specifically protects minority rights in education.

question:
How many languages are included in the Eighth Schedule of the Constitution of India as scheduled languages?

SSC CHSL 09/07/2024 (2nd shift)
solution:
• The Eighth Schedule of the Indian Constitution currently includes 22 scheduled languages.
  • These languages are recognized by the Constitution and are given official status for various purposes including representation in the Parliament, use in official communication, and promotion of cultural heritage.

Additional Information:

  • The number of scheduled languages has increased over time through various amendments.
  • The original Constitution listed 14 languages; this number has grown to 22.
  • Some of the scheduled languages include Hindi, Bengali, Telugu, Marathi, Tamil, Urdu, Gujarati, Kannada, Odia, Punjabi, and Malayalam.

question:
Article 15 of the Constitution of India entails:

SSC CHSL 09/07/2024 (3rd shift)
option_1: equality of opportunity for all citizens in matters relating to employment or appointment
option_2: prohibition of discrimination against any citizen on grounds only of religion, race, caste, sex or place of birth
option_3: cultural and educational rights
option_4: freedom of speech and expression
solution:
• Article 15 of the Indian Constitution prohibits discrimination by the State against any citizen on grounds only of religion, race, caste, sex, place of birth, or any of them.
  • It ensures equality before the law and forbids the State from making any special laws that discriminate against individuals on these grounds.
  • This article is a fundamental right under Part III of the Constitution.

Additional Information:

  • Article 16: Provides equality of opportunity in matters of employment or appointment.
  • Article 29 and 30: Protect cultural and educational rights of minorities.
  • Article 19(1)(a): Guarantees freedom of speech and expression.
  • Article 15 also allows for special provisions for the advancement of Scheduled Castes, Scheduled Tribes, and women.

question:
Which of the following Articles of the Indian Constitution are related to Fundamental Rights?

SSC CHSL 09/07/2024 (4th shift)
solution:
• Articles 12 to 35 of the Indian Constitution deal with Fundamental Rights.
  • These articles enshrine the basic rights guaranteed to all citizens to ensure liberty, equality, and justice.
  • They include rights such as Right to Equality, Right to Freedom, Right against Exploitation, Right to Freedom of Religion, Cultural and Educational Rights, and Right to Constitutional Remedies.

Additional Information:

  • Article 12: Defines the term ‘State’ for the purpose of Fundamental Rights.
  • Article 14 to 18: Cover Right to Equality.
  • Article 19: Covers Right to Freedom.
  • Article 21: Guarantees Right to Life and Personal Liberty.
  • Article 32: Provides the Right to Constitutional Remedies.
  • Articles 36 to 51: Cover the Directive Principles of State Policy.

question:
'Reservation in promotion' comes under which Article of the Constitution?

SSC CHSL 10/07/2024 (2nd shift)
solution:
• Article 16(4A) of the Indian Constitution deals with reservation in promotion for Scheduled Castes (SCs) and Scheduled Tribes (STs).
  • It empowers the State to make provisions for the reservation of appointments or posts in favor of SCs and STs in public employment, specifically in promotions.
  • This amendment was introduced by the 77th Constitutional Amendment Act, 1995.

Additional Information:

  • Article 19(2): Allows reasonable restrictions on the right to freedom of speech and expression.
  • Article 14: Provides for equality before the law and equal protection of the laws.
  • Article 15(3): Allows the State to make special provisions for women and children.
  • Article 16(4A): Specifically addresses reservations in promotions in public services.

question:
Articles 344 (1) and 351 of the Constitution of India are related to the:

SSC CHSL 11/07/2024 (1st shift)
solution:
• Articles 344(1) and 351 of the Indian Constitution are related to the Eighth Schedule.
  • Article 344(1) provides for the appointment of a Commissioner for Linguistic Minorities to safeguard the interests of linguistic minorities.
  • Article 351 directs the Union government to promote the spread of the Hindi language and to develop it so that it can serve as a medium of expression for all parts of India.
  • Both articles focus on language policy and protection linked to the scheduled languages listed in the Eighth Schedule.

Additional Information:

  • Eighth Schedule lists the scheduled languages recognized by the Constitution.
  • Third Schedule: Contains the forms of oaths and affirmations.
  • Fifth Schedule: Deals with administration and control of Scheduled Areas and Scheduled Tribes.
  • Sixth Schedule: Relates to autonomous tribal areas in Northeast India.

question:
In which Article does the Finance Commission of India find a mention?

SSC CPO 27/06/2024 (1st shift)
solution:
• The Finance Commission of India is mentioned in Article 280 of the Indian Constitution.
  • Article 280 provides for the constitution of the Finance Commission by the President every five years or earlier.
  • The Finance Commission recommends the distribution of revenues between the Union and the States and among the States themselves.

Additional Information:

  • Article 292: Deals with the borrowing powers of the Union.
  • Article 375: Relates to the extension of laws to states.
  • Article 370: Provided special autonomous status to Jammu and Kashmir (now abrogated).
  • The Finance Commission plays a crucial role in fiscal federalism by ensuring equitable resource distribution.

question:
As per Article ____________ of the Indian Constitution, the Council of Ministers are collectively responsible to the Lok Sabha.

SSC CPO 27/06/2024 (1st shift)
solution:
• As per Article 75(3) of the Indian Constitution, the Council of Ministers is collectively responsible to the Lok Sabha.
  • This means the entire Council of Ministers must maintain the confidence of the Lok Sabha and can be dismissed if it loses majority support.
  • Collective responsibility is a key feature of the parliamentary system in India.

Additional Information:

  • Article 74(1): Provides for the President to act on the advice of the Council of Ministers.
  • Article 72(1): Deals with the power of the President to grant pardons and reprieves.
  • Article 73(2): Relates to the extent of executive power of the Union.
  • Article 75(3): Specifically mentions collective responsibility of Ministers to the Lok Sabha.

question:
Biological Diversity Act 2002 was passed by the Government of India. It fulfilled ideals of which article of Directive Principles of State Policy in the Constitution of India?

SSC CPO 27/06/2024 (1st shift)
solution:
• The Biological Diversity Act, 2002 was enacted to conserve biological diversity, sustainable use of its components, and fair sharing of benefits arising from the use of biological resources.
  • It fulfills the ideals of Article 48A of the Directive Principles of State Policy in the Indian Constitution.
  • Article 48A directs the State to protect and improve the environment and safeguard forests and wildlife.

Additional Information:

  • Article 49: Deals with the protection of monuments and places of national importance.
  • Article 48: Relates to the organization of agriculture and animal husbandry.
  • Article 47: Concerns the duty of the State to raise the level of nutrition and improve public health.
  • The Biological Diversity Act aligns with environmental protection and sustainability goals in Article 48A.

question:
Which Article of the Indian Constitution mentions about the right of the Governor to address and to send messages to the House (or Houses) of the state legislature?

SSC CPO 27/06/2024 (2nd shift)
solution:
• Article 175 of the Indian Constitution mentions the right of the Governor to address and send messages to the House (or Houses) of the State Legislature.
  • It empowers the Governor to address the Legislative Assembly or both Houses of the Legislature and send messages for consideration of the Legislature.
  • This article also mandates the Governor to cause the annual financial statement (budget) to be laid before the State Legislature.

Additional Information:

  • Article 171: Deals with the composition of the State Legislative Councils.
  • Article 172: Relates to the duration of the State Legislature.
  • Article 176: Concerns the salaries and allowances of the Speaker and Deputy Speaker of the State Legislative Assembly.
  • Article 175 plays a key role in the functioning and communication between the Governor and the State Legislature.

question:
Which of the following parts of the Indian Constitution is commonly referred to as the ‘Magna Carta of India’?

SSC CPO 27/06/2024 (2nd shift)
solution:
• Part III of the Indian Constitution is commonly referred to as the ‘Magna Carta of India’.
  • Part III contains the Fundamental Rights, which guarantee civil liberties such as equality, freedom, and protection against discrimination to all citizens.
  • These rights serve as the cornerstone for the protection of individual freedoms and democracy in India.

Additional Information:

  • Part I: Deals with the Union and its territory.
  • Part II: Covers citizenship.
  • Part IV: Contains the Directive Principles of State Policy.
  • The term ‘Magna Carta of India’ highlights the importance of Fundamental Rights in safeguarding the liberties of citizens.

question:
Which Article of the Indian Constitution mentions about the salaries and allowances of the Chairman and Deputy Chairman of the Rajya Sabha and the Speaker and Deputy Speaker of the Lok Sabha?

SSC CPO 27/06/2024 (3rd shift)
solution:
• Article 97 of the Indian Constitution mentions the salaries and allowances of the Chairman and Deputy Chairman of the Rajya Sabha and the Speaker and Deputy Speaker of the Lok Sabha.
  • This article empowers Parliament to determine these salaries and allowances by law.
  • It ensures that these important parliamentary positions receive remuneration as prescribed by legislation.

Additional Information:

  • Article 94: Deals with the disqualification of the Speaker and Deputy Speaker of the Lok Sabha.
  • Article 95: Relates to the powers, privileges, and immunities of the Speaker and Deputy Speaker of the Lok Sabha.
  • Article 92: Concerns the vacancies in the offices of Speaker and Deputy Speaker.
  • Article 97 is key for the financial and official status of presiding officers of both Houses of Parliament.

question:
Which of the following Articles of the Indian Constitution mentions that the Vice- President of India shall be the ex officio Chairman of the Council of States?

SSC CPO 27/06/2024 (3rd shift)
solution:
• Article 89 of the Indian Constitution mentions that the Vice-President of India shall be the ex officio Chairman of the Council of States (Rajya Sabha).
  • This article defines the office and duties of the Chairman of the Rajya Sabha.

question:
Which Article of the Indian Constitution mentions about the right of the Advocate- General of a state to speak in the State Legislature?

SSC CPO 28/06/2024 (1st shift)
solution:
• Article 177 of the Indian Constitution mentions the right of the Advocate-General of a State to speak in the State Legislature.
  • It provides that the Advocate-General shall have the right to speak in, and otherwise to take part in the proceedings of, both Houses of the Legislature of the State but shall not have the right to vote.
  • This ensures the Advocate-General can advise and assist the Legislature on legal matters.

Additional Information:

  • Article 179: Deals with the Speaker and Deputy Speaker of the Legislative Assembly.
  • Article 181: Relates to the powers, privileges, and immunities of the State Legislature and its members.
  • Article 183: Covers the sessions of the State Legislature.
  • Article 177 safeguards the role of the Advocate-General in the legislative process.

question:
Which Article of the Indian Constitution mentions that ‘The Council of Ministers shall be collectively responsible to the Legislative Assembly of the state’?

SSC CPO 28/06/2024 (2nd shift)
solution:
• Article 164(2) of the Indian Constitution mentions that “The Council of Ministers shall be collectively responsible to the Legislative Assembly of the State.”
  • This establishes the principle of collective responsibility of the state Council of Ministers towards the elected Legislative Assembly.
  • It means that the entire Council of Ministers must maintain the confidence of the Legislative Assembly and can be dismissed if it loses majority support.

Additional Information:

  • Article 164(1): Deals with the appointment of the Chief Minister and other Ministers by the Governor.
  • Article 164(3): States that the Council of Ministers shall aid and advise the Governor.
  • Article 164(4): Relates to the disqualification of ministers on grounds of defection.
  • Collective responsibility is a key feature of the parliamentary system at the state level.

question:
Which Article specifies the procedure for amending the Indian Constitution?

SSC CPO 28/06/2024 (3rd shift)
solution:
• Article 368 of the Indian Constitution specifies the procedure for amending the Constitution.
  • It empowers Parliament to amend the Constitution by way of addition, variation, or repeal of any provision, following the prescribed procedure.
  • The amendment procedure can vary depending on the nature of the amendment, requiring simple majority, special majority, or ratification by states.

Additional Information:

  • Article 365: Relates to failure of constitutional machinery in states.
  • Article 366: Contains definitions for terms used in the Constitution.
  • Article 367: Provides interpretation guidelines for the Constitution.
  • Article 368 is crucial for constitutional flexibility and evolution.
